intro: Catalpa punctata var. domingensis, commonly known as the Mexican catalpa, is a deciduous tree native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The tree produces long, cylindrical pods that contain sticky, winged seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
